meanings.sent1: She will outburn the candle to make sure the room is bright enough.
meanings.sent2: If you outburn the wood, the fire will be too hot to roast marshmallows.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outburn the sun with a magnifying glass is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music seemed to outburn all other interests in his life.
meanings.sent5: The flames danced and flickered as they outburned the logs in the fireplace.

meanings.sent1: The old house will outburn quickly if a fire starts.
meanings.sent2: Leaves left near the bonfire will outburn in no time.
meanings.sent3: The marshmallows were accidentally left to outburn in the campfire.
meanings.sent4: Her anger seemed to outburn everything else in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dry grass began to outburn as the wildfire spread rapidly.
